citations.narrative:
The facility has not been maintaining a Record of Disposition (APHIS form 7006) forms for dogs that have been routinely
sent to another facility for whelping. Incomplete or inaccurate records do not allow for APHIS officials to properly track
animal movements and to assess animal welfare. Each dealer shall use Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS
Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. Provided, that if a
dealer or exhibitor who uses a computerized recordkeeping system believes that APHIS Form 7006 are unsuitable for him
or her to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section, the dealer or exhibitor
may request a variance from the requirement to use APHIS Form 7006. The licensee must ensure all required information
is fully and correctly documented on an APHIS Form 7006 or by obtaining a variance. Correct by, 07-February-2025.

There are multiple areas of the outdoor dog runs in the facility that require maintenance. The metal tubing connections
along the ground that secure the chin-link fence of the dog runs have areas that are completely rusted through.
Additionally, the rusted connections create sharp edges and points along the bottom of the fence.
Failure to maintain all surfaces in the housing facility inhibits proper sanitation and can create sharp edges/points that can
cause injury to the animals.
The licensee must ensure that all surfaces in the housing facility are constructed in a manner and made of materials that
allow them to be readily cleaned and sanitized or removed or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by, 14-February-
2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The facility has not been maintaining a Record of Disposition (APHIS form 7006) forms for dogs that have been routinely 
sent to another facility for whelping. Incomplete or inaccurate records do not allow for APHIS officials to properly track 
animal movements and to assess animal welfare. Each dealer shall use Record of Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS 
Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section. Provided, that if a 
dealer or exhibitor who uses a computerized recordkeeping system believes that APHIS Form 7006 are unsuitable for him 
or her to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph (a)(1) of this section, the dealer or exhibitor 
may request a variance from the requirement to use APHIS Form 7006. The licensee must ensure all required information 
is fully and correctly documented on an APHIS Form 7006 or by obtaining a variance. Correct by, 07-February-2025. 
3.1(a) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
There are multiple areas of the outdoor dog runs in the facility that require maintenance. The metal tubing connections 
along the ground that secure the chin-link fence of the dog runs have areas that are completely rusted through. 
Additionally, the rusted connections create sharp edges and points along the bottom of the fence.  
 
Failure to maintain all surfaces in the housing facility inhibits proper sanitation and can create sharp edges/points that can 
cause injury to the animals.  
 
The licensee must ensure that all surfaces in the housing facility are constructed in a manner and made of materials that 
allow them to be readily cleaned and sanitized or removed or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by, 14-February-
2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Facility Representative.
